{"step_by_step_thinking": "The question asks about loss of flexion in the interphalangeal joint of thumb in a supracondylar fracture. Supracondylar fractures occur at the upper end of the radius and are characterized by radial nerve damage. Since the question is specifically asking about the interphalangeal joint of the thumb, which is innervated by the median nerve, it suggests that the median nerve is likely involved.", "answer_choice": "C"}
